definition: to chop sb in half at the waist (capital punishment)/to cut sth in half/to reduce sth by a dramatic margin/to terminate/to cut short
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop

sentences.english: She has become the first person to survive being cut in half.
sentences.chinese: 她是史上第一位接受腰斩手术而存活的人。

sentences.english: The love game is never called off on account of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 恋爱游戏并不会因为天黑就可以腰斩的。

sentences.english: The stock halved in value and analysts were calculating the odds on AIG's survival.
sentences.chinese: 该股价格被腰斩，分析人士已在估计它的幸存几率。

sentences.english: If oil is cut to $60 a barrel, Russia is sunk.
sentences.chinese: 如果油价被腰斩至60美元每桶，俄国会跌倒。

sentences.english: Too many designs are rejected because the boss "doesn't like green."
sentences.chinese: 太多的设计被腰斩的原因是因为老板“不喜欢绿色”。

definition: the lingering death/the death of a thousand cuts (old form of capital punishment)
devastating setback/slump (in stock market etc)/crushing defeat/to cause a serious setback/to plummet
to tear off a person's four limbs and head using five horse drawn carts (as capital punishment)/to tear limb from limb
lit. plaintive whine of geese (idiom); fig. land swarming with disaster victims/starving people fill the land
to behead sb and display the head in public
